titleInfo.title: R U N A W A Y.

subject.geographic: Bayou Grosse Tete, parish of Iberville, five miles below the depot
Bayou Grosse Tete, parish of Iberville, five miles below the depot

mods.abstract: R U N A W A Y . FROM the plantation of Charles Booksh, on Bayou Grosse Tete, parish of Iberville, five miles below the Depot, on Saturday last, 21st instant. a slave named JACK, and calls himself Hall back. Said slave is a griff. aged about 23 years; measures 5 feet 6 or 7 inches in height; is strongly built; wears mustaches, of sullen look; and is an American negro lately from Georgia. A reasonable reward will be paid to any person who will arrest and ldoge in jail, or deliver to the subscriber the aforesaid slave. Bayou-Grosse Tete, Iberville, May 23, 1859. my28-tf. CHARLES BOOKSH.

detail.title: Pointe Coupee Democrat. : (False River [i.e. New Roads], Parish of Pointe Coupee [La.]) 1858-1884
